7// ProgramLinkedResources.cpp: implements link-time checks for default block uniforms, and generates
8// uniform locations. Populates data structures related to uniforms so that they can be stored in
9// program state.
10
11#include "libANGLE/ProgramLinkedResources.h"
12
13#include "common/string_utils.h"
14#include "common/utilities.h"
15#include "libANGLE/Caps.h"
16#include "libANGLE/Context.h"
17#include "libANGLE/Shader.h"
18#include "libANGLE/features.h"

20namespace gl
21{
22namespace
23{
24LinkedUniform *FindUniform(std::vector<LinkedUniform> &list, const std::string &name)
25{
26 for (LinkedUniform &uniform : list)
27 {
28 if (uniform.name == name)
29 return &uniform;
30 }
31
32 return nullptr;
33}
34
35template <typename VarT>
36void SetActive(std::vector<VarT> *list, const std::string &name, ShaderType shaderType, bool active)
37{
38 for (auto &variable : *list)
39 {
40 if (variable.name == name)
41 {
42 variable.setActive(shaderType, active);
43 return;
44 }
45 }
46}
47
48// GLSL ES Spec 3.00.3, section 4.3.5.
49LinkMismatchError LinkValidateUniforms(const sh::ShaderVariable &uniform1,
50 const sh::ShaderVariable &uniform2,
51 std::string *mismatchedStructFieldName)
52{
53#if ANGLE_PROGRAM_LINK_VALIDATE_UNIFORM_PRECISION == ANGLE_ENABLED
54 const bool validatePrecisionFeature = true;
55#else
56 const bool validatePrecisionFeature = false;
57#endif
58
59 // Validate precision match of uniforms iff they are statically used
60 bool validatePrecision = uniform1.staticUse && uniform2.staticUse && validatePrecisionFeature;
61 LinkMismatchError linkError = Program::LinkValidateVariablesBase(
62 uniform1, uniform2, validatePrecision, true, mismatchedStructFieldName);
63 if (linkError != LinkMismatchError::NO_MISMATCH)
64 {
65 return linkError;
66 }
67
68 // GLSL ES Spec 3.10.4, section 4.4.5.
69 if (uniform1.binding != -1 && uniform2.binding != -1 && uniform1.binding != uniform2.binding)
70 {
71 return LinkMismatchError::BINDING_MISMATCH;
72 }
73
74 // GLSL ES Spec 3.10.4, section 9.2.1.
75 if (uniform1.location != -1 && uniform2.location != -1 &&
76 uniform1.location != uniform2.location)
77 {
78 return LinkMismatchError::LOCATION_MISMATCH;
79 }
80 if (uniform1.offset != uniform2.offset)
81 {
82 return LinkMismatchError::OFFSET_MISMATCH;
83 }
84
85 return LinkMismatchError::NO_MISMATCH;
86}
87
88using ShaderUniform = std::pair<ShaderType, const sh::ShaderVariable *>;
89
90bool ValidateGraphicsUniformsPerShader(Shader *shaderToLink,
91 bool extendLinkedUniforms,
92 std::map<std::string, ShaderUniform> *linkedUniforms,
93 InfoLog &infoLog)
94{
95 ASSERT(shaderToLink && linkedUniforms);
96
97 for (const sh::ShaderVariable &uniform : shaderToLink->getUniforms())
98 {
99 const auto &entry = linkedUniforms->find(uniform.name);
100 if (entry != linkedUniforms->end())
101 {
102 const sh::ShaderVariable &linkedUniform = *(entry->second.second);
103 std::string mismatchedStructFieldName;
104 LinkMismatchError linkError =
105 LinkValidateUniforms(uniform, linkedUniform, &mismatchedStructFieldName);
106 if (linkError != LinkMismatchError::NO_MISMATCH)
107 {
108 LogLinkMismatch(infoLog, uniform.name, "uniform", linkError,
109 mismatchedStructFieldName, entry->second.first,
110 shaderToLink->getType());
111 return false;
112 }
113 }
114 else if (extendLinkedUniforms)
115 {
116 (*linkedUniforms)[uniform.name] = std::make_pair(shaderToLink->getType(), &uniform);
117 }
118 }
119
120 return true;
121}
122
123GLuint GetMaximumShaderUniformVectors(ShaderType shaderType, const Caps &caps)
124{
125 switch (shaderType)
126 {
127 case ShaderType::Vertex:
128 return static_cast<GLuint>(caps.maxVertexUniformVectors);
129 case ShaderType::Fragment:
130 return static_cast<GLuint>(caps.maxFragmentUniformVectors);
131
132 case ShaderType::Compute:
133 case ShaderType::Geometry:
134 return static_cast<GLuint>(caps.maxShaderUniformComponents[shaderType]) / 4;
135
136 default:
137 UNREACHABLE();
138 return 0u;
139 }
140}
141
142enum class UniformType : uint8_t
143{
144 Variable = 0,
145 Sampler = 1,
146 Image = 2,
147 AtomicCounter = 3,
148
149 InvalidEnum = 4,
150 EnumCount = 4,
151};
152
153const char *GetUniformResourceNameString(UniformType uniformType)
154{
155 switch (uniformType)
156 {
157 case UniformType::Variable:
158 return "uniform";
159 case UniformType::Sampler:
160 return "texture image unit";
161 case UniformType::Image:
162 return "image uniform";
163 case UniformType::AtomicCounter:
164 return "atomic counter";
165 default:
166 UNREACHABLE();
167 return "";
168 }
169}
170
171std::string GetUniformResourceLimitName(ShaderType shaderType, UniformType uniformType)
172{
173 // Special case: MAX_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS (no "MAX_FRAGMENT_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS")
174 if (shaderType == ShaderType::Fragment && uniformType == UniformType::Sampler)
175 {
176 return "MAX_TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS";
177 }
178
179 std::ostringstream ostream;
180 ostream << "MAX_" << GetShaderTypeString(shaderType) << "_";
181
182 switch (uniformType)
183 {
184 case UniformType::Variable:
185 // For vertex and fragment shaders, ES 2.0 only defines MAX_VERTEX_UNIFORM_VECTORS and
186 // MAX_FRAGMENT_UNIFORM_VECTORS ([OpenGL ES 2.0] Table 6.20).
187 if (shaderType == ShaderType::Vertex || shaderType == ShaderType::Fragment)
188 {
189 ostream << "UNIFORM_VECTORS";
190 break;
191 }
192 // For compute and geometry shaders, there are no definitions on
193 // "MAX_COMPUTE_UNIFORM_VECTORS" or "MAX_GEOMETRY_UNIFORM_VECTORS_EXT"
194 // ([OpenGL ES 3.1] Table 20.45, [EXT_geometry_shader] Table 20.43gs).
195 else
196 {
197 ostream << "UNIFORM_COMPONENTS";
198 }
199 break;
200 case UniformType::Sampler:
201 ostream << "TEXTURE_IMAGE_UNITS";
202 break;
203 case UniformType::Image:
204 ostream << "IMAGE_UNIFORMS";
205 break;
206 case UniformType::AtomicCounter:
207 ostream << "ATOMIC_COUNTERS";
208 break;
209 default:
210 UNREACHABLE();
211 return "";
212 }
213
214 if (shaderType == ShaderType::Geometry)
215 {
216 ostream << "_EXT";
217 }
218
219 return ostream.str();
220}
221
222void LogUniformsExceedLimit(ShaderType shaderType,
223 UniformType uniformType,
224 GLuint limit,
225 InfoLog &infoLog)
226{
227 infoLog << GetShaderTypeString(shaderType) << " shader "
228 << GetUniformResourceNameString(uniformType) << "s count exceeds "
229 << GetUniformResourceLimitName(shaderType, uniformType) << "(" << limit << ")";
230}
231
232// The purpose of this visitor is to capture the uniforms in a uniform block. Each new uniform is
233// added to "uniformsOut".
234class UniformBlockEncodingVisitor : public sh::VariableNameVisitor
235{
236 public:
237 UniformBlockEncodingVisitor(const GetBlockMemberInfoFunc &getMemberInfo,
238 const std::string &namePrefix,
239 const std::string &mappedNamePrefix,
240 std::vector<LinkedUniform> *uniformsOut,
241 ShaderType shaderType,
242 int blockIndex)
243 : sh::VariableNameVisitor(namePrefix, mappedNamePrefix),
244 mGetMemberInfo(getMemberInfo),
245 mUniformsOut(uniformsOut),
246 mShaderType(shaderType),
247 mBlockIndex(blockIndex)
248 {}
249
250 void visitNamedVariable(const sh::ShaderVariable &variable,
251 bool isRowMajor,
252 const std::string &name,
253 const std::string &mappedName,
254 const std::vector<unsigned int> &arraySizes) override
255 {
256 // If getBlockMemberInfo returns false, the variable is optimized out.
257 sh::BlockMemberInfo variableInfo;
258 if (!mGetMemberInfo(name, mappedName, &variableInfo))
259 return;
260
261 std::string nameWithArrayIndex = name;
262 std::string mappedNameWithArrayIndex = mappedName;
263
264 if (variable.isArray())
265 {
266 nameWithArrayIndex += "[0]";
267 mappedNameWithArrayIndex += "[0]";
268 }
269
270 if (mBlockIndex == -1)
271 {
272 SetActive(mUniformsOut, nameWithArrayIndex, mShaderType, variable.active);
273 return;
274 }
275
276 LinkedUniform newUniform(variable.type, variable.precision, nameWithArrayIndex,
277 variable.arraySizes, -1, -1, -1, mBlockIndex, variableInfo);
278 newUniform.mappedName = mappedNameWithArrayIndex;
279 newUniform.setActive(mShaderType, variable.active);
280
281 // Since block uniforms have no location, we don't need to store them in the uniform
282 // locations list.
283 mUniformsOut->push_back(newUniform);
284 }
285
286 private:
287 const GetBlockMemberInfoFunc &mGetMemberInfo;
288 std::vector<LinkedUniform> *mUniformsOut;
289 const ShaderType mShaderType;
290 const int mBlockIndex;
291};
292
293// The purpose of this visitor is to capture the buffer variables in a shader storage block. Each
294// new buffer variable is stored in "bufferVariablesOut".
295class ShaderStorageBlockVisitor : public sh::BlockEncoderVisitor
296{
297 public:
298 ShaderStorageBlockVisitor(const GetBlockMemberInfoFunc &getMemberInfo,
299 const std::string &namePrefix,
300 const std::string &mappedNamePrefix,
301 std::vector<BufferVariable> *bufferVariablesOut,
302 ShaderType shaderType,
303 int blockIndex)
304 : sh::BlockEncoderVisitor(namePrefix, mappedNamePrefix, &mStubEncoder),
305 mGetMemberInfo(getMemberInfo),
306 mBufferVariablesOut(bufferVariablesOut),
307 mShaderType(shaderType),
308 mBlockIndex(blockIndex)
309 {}
310
311 void visitNamedVariable(const sh::ShaderVariable &variable,
312 bool isRowMajor,
313 const std::string &name,
314 const std::string &mappedName,
315 const std::vector<unsigned int> &arraySizes) override
316 {
317 if (mSkipEnabled)
318 return;
319
320 // If getBlockMemberInfo returns false, the variable is optimized out.
321 sh::BlockMemberInfo variableInfo;
322 if (!mGetMemberInfo(name, mappedName, &variableInfo))
323 return;
324
325 std::string nameWithArrayIndex = name;
326 std::string mappedNameWithArrayIndex = mappedName;
327
328 if (variable.isArray())
329 {
330 nameWithArrayIndex += "[0]";
331 mappedNameWithArrayIndex += "[0]";
332 }
333
334 if (mBlockIndex == -1)
335 {
336 SetActive(mBufferVariablesOut, nameWithArrayIndex, mShaderType, variable.active);
337 return;
338 }
339
340 BufferVariable newBufferVariable(variable.type, variable.precision, nameWithArrayIndex,
341 variable.arraySizes, mBlockIndex, variableInfo);
342 newBufferVariable.mappedName = mappedNameWithArrayIndex;
343 newBufferVariable.setActive(mShaderType, variable.active);
344
345 newBufferVariable.topLevelArraySize = mTopLevelArraySize;
346
347 mBufferVariablesOut->push_back(newBufferVariable);
348 }
349
350 private:
351 const GetBlockMemberInfoFunc &mGetMemberInfo;
352 std::vector<BufferVariable> *mBufferVariablesOut;
353 const ShaderType mShaderType;
354 const int mBlockIndex;
355 sh::StubBlockEncoder mStubEncoder;
356};
357
358struct ShaderUniformCount
359{
360 unsigned int vectorCount = 0;
361 unsigned int samplerCount = 0;
362 unsigned int imageCount = 0;
363 unsigned int atomicCounterCount = 0;
364};
365
366ShaderUniformCount &operator+=(ShaderUniformCount &lhs, const ShaderUniformCount &rhs)
367{
368 lhs.vectorCount += rhs.vectorCount;
369 lhs.samplerCount += rhs.samplerCount;
370 lhs.imageCount += rhs.imageCount;
371 lhs.atomicCounterCount += rhs.atomicCounterCount;
372 return lhs;
373}
374
375// The purpose of this visitor is to flatten struct and array uniforms into a list of singleton
376// uniforms. They are stored in separate lists by uniform type so they can be sorted in order.
377// Counts for each uniform category are stored and can be queried with "getCounts".
378class FlattenUniformVisitor : public sh::VariableNameVisitor
379{
380 public:
381 FlattenUniformVisitor(ShaderType shaderType,
382 const sh::ShaderVariable &uniform,
383 std::vector<LinkedUniform> *uniforms,
384 std::vector<LinkedUniform> *samplerUniforms,
385 std::vector<LinkedUniform> *imageUniforms,
386 std::vector<LinkedUniform> *atomicCounterUniforms,
387 std::vector<UnusedUniform> *unusedUniforms)
388 : sh::VariableNameVisitor("", ""),
389 mShaderType(shaderType),
390 mMarkActive(uniform.active),
391 mMarkStaticUse(uniform.staticUse),
392 mBinding(uniform.binding),
393 mOffset(uniform.offset),
394 mLocation(uniform.location),
395 mUniforms(uniforms),
396 mSamplerUniforms(samplerUniforms),
397 mImageUniforms(imageUniforms),
398 mAtomicCounterUniforms(atomicCounterUniforms),
399 mUnusedUniforms(unusedUniforms)
400 {}
401
402 void visitNamedSamplerOrImage(const sh::ShaderVariable &sampler,
403 const std::string &name,
404 const std::string &mappedName,
405 const std::vector<unsigned int> &arraySizes) override
406 {
407 visitNamedVariable(sampler, false, name, mappedName, arraySizes);
408 }
409
410 void visitNamedVariable(const sh::ShaderVariable &variable,
411 bool isRowMajor,
412 const std::string &name,
413 const std::string &mappedName,
414 const std::vector<unsigned int> &arraySizes) override
415 {
416 bool isSampler = IsSamplerType(variable.type);
417 bool isImage = IsImageType(variable.type);
418 bool isAtomicCounter = IsAtomicCounterType(variable.type);
419 std::vector<LinkedUniform> *uniformList = mUniforms;
420 if (isSampler)
421 {
422 uniformList = mSamplerUniforms;
423 }
424 else if (isImage)
425 {
426 uniformList = mImageUniforms;
427 }
428 else if (isAtomicCounter)
429 {
430 uniformList = mAtomicCounterUniforms;
431 }
432
433 std::string fullNameWithArrayIndex(name);
434 std::string fullMappedNameWithArrayIndex(mappedName);
435
436 if (variable.isArray())
437 {
438 // We're following the GLES 3.1 November 2016 spec section 7.3.1.1 Naming Active
439 // Resources and including [0] at the end of array variable names.
440 fullNameWithArrayIndex += "[0]";
441 fullMappedNameWithArrayIndex += "[0]";
442 }
443
444 LinkedUniform *existingUniform = FindUniform(*uniformList, fullNameWithArrayIndex);
445 if (existingUniform)
446 {
447 if (getBinding() != -1)
448 {
449 existingUniform->binding = getBinding();
450 }
451 if (getOffset() != -1)
452 {
453 existingUniform->offset = getOffset();
454 }
455 if (mLocation != -1)
456 {
457 existingUniform->location = mLocation;
458 }
459 if (mMarkActive)
460 {
461 existingUniform->active = true;
462 existingUniform->setActive(mShaderType, true);
463 }
464 if (mMarkStaticUse)
465 {
466 existingUniform->staticUse = true;
467 }
468 }
469 else
470 {
471 LinkedUniform linkedUniform(variable.type, variable.precision, fullNameWithArrayIndex,
472 variable.arraySizes, getBinding(), getOffset(), mLocation,
473 -1, sh::kDefaultBlockMemberInfo);
474 linkedUniform.mappedName = fullMappedNameWithArrayIndex;
475 linkedUniform.active = mMarkActive;
476 linkedUniform.staticUse = mMarkStaticUse;
477 linkedUniform.outerArraySizes = arraySizes;
478 linkedUniform.texelFetchStaticUse = variable.texelFetchStaticUse;
479 if (variable.hasParentArrayIndex())
480 {
481 linkedUniform.setParentArrayIndex(variable.parentArrayIndex());
482 }
483 if (mMarkActive)
484 {
485 linkedUniform.setActive(mShaderType, true);
486 }
487 else
488 {
489 mUnusedUniforms->emplace_back(linkedUniform.name, linkedUniform.isSampler(),
490 linkedUniform.isImage(),
491 linkedUniform.isAtomicCounter());
492 }
493
494 uniformList->push_back(linkedUniform);
495 }
496
497 unsigned int elementCount = variable.getBasicTypeElementCount();
498
499 // Samplers and images aren't "real" uniforms, so they don't count towards register usage.
500 // Likewise, don't count "real" uniforms towards opaque count.
501
502 if (!IsOpaqueType(variable.type))
503 {
504 mUniformCount.vectorCount += VariableRegisterCount(variable.type) * elementCount;
505 }
506
507 mUniformCount.samplerCount += (isSampler ? elementCount : 0);
508 mUniformCount.imageCount += (isImage ? elementCount : 0);
509 mUniformCount.atomicCounterCount += (isAtomicCounter ? elementCount : 0);
510
511 if (mLocation != -1)
512 {
513 mLocation += elementCount;
514 }
515 }
516
517 void enterStructAccess(const sh::ShaderVariable &structVar, bool isRowMajor) override
518 {
519 mStructStackSize++;
520 sh::VariableNameVisitor::enterStructAccess(structVar, isRowMajor);
521 }
522
523 void exitStructAccess(const sh::ShaderVariable &structVar, bool isRowMajor) override
524 {
525 mStructStackSize--;
526 sh::VariableNameVisitor::exitStructAccess(structVar, isRowMajor);
527 }
528
529 ShaderUniformCount getCounts() const { return mUniformCount; }
530
531 private:
532 int getBinding() const { return mStructStackSize == 0 ? mBinding : -1; }
533 int getOffset() const { return mStructStackSize == 0 ? mOffset : -1; }
534
535 ShaderType mShaderType;
536
537 // Active and StaticUse are given separately because they are tracked at struct granularity.
538 bool mMarkActive;
539 bool mMarkStaticUse;
540 int mBinding;
541 int mOffset;
542 int mLocation;
543 std::vector<LinkedUniform> *mUniforms;
544 std::vector<LinkedUniform> *mSamplerUniforms;
545 std::vector<LinkedUniform> *mImageUniforms;
546 std::vector<LinkedUniform> *mAtomicCounterUniforms;
547 std::vector<UnusedUniform> *mUnusedUniforms;
548 ShaderUniformCount mUniformCount;
549 unsigned int mStructStackSize = 0;
550};
551
552class InterfaceBlockInfo final : angle::NonCopyable
553{
554 public:
555 InterfaceBlockInfo(CustomBlockLayoutEncoderFactory *customEncoderFactory)
556 : mCustomEncoderFactory(customEncoderFactory)
557 {}
558
559 void getShaderBlockInfo(const std::vector<sh::InterfaceBlock> &interfaceBlocks);
560
561 bool getBlockSize(const std::string &name, const std::string &mappedName, size_t *sizeOut);
562 bool getBlockMemberInfo(const std::string &name,
563 const std::string &mappedName,
564 sh::BlockMemberInfo *infoOut);
565
566 private:
567 size_t getBlockInfo(const sh::InterfaceBlock &interfaceBlock);
568
569 std::map<std::string, size_t> mBlockSizes;
570 sh::BlockLayoutMap mBlockLayout;
571 // Based on the interface block layout, the std140 or std430 encoders are used. On some
572 // platforms (currently only D3D), there could be another non-standard encoder used.
573 CustomBlockLayoutEncoderFactory *mCustomEncoderFactory;
574};
575
576void InterfaceBlockInfo::getShaderBlockInfo(const std::vector<sh::InterfaceBlock> &interfaceBlocks)
577{
578 for (const sh::InterfaceBlock &interfaceBlock : interfaceBlocks)
579 {
580 if (!IsActiveInterfaceBlock(interfaceBlock))
581 continue;
582
583 if (mBlockSizes.count(interfaceBlock.name) > 0)
584 continue;
585
586 size_t dataSize = getBlockInfo(interfaceBlock);
587 mBlockSizes[interfaceBlock.name] = dataSize;
588 }
589}
590
591size_t InterfaceBlockInfo::getBlockInfo(const sh::InterfaceBlock &interfaceBlock)
592{
593 ASSERT(IsActiveInterfaceBlock(interfaceBlock));
594
595 // define member uniforms
596 sh::Std140BlockEncoder std140Encoder;
597 sh::Std430BlockEncoder std430Encoder;
598 sh::BlockLayoutEncoder *customEncoder = nullptr;
599 sh::BlockLayoutEncoder *encoder = nullptr;
600
601 if (interfaceBlock.layout == sh::BLOCKLAYOUT_STD140)
602 {
603 encoder = &std140Encoder;
604 }
605 else if (interfaceBlock.layout == sh::BLOCKLAYOUT_STD430)
606 {
607 encoder = &std430Encoder;
608 }
609 else if (mCustomEncoderFactory)
610 {
611 encoder = customEncoder = mCustomEncoderFactory->makeEncoder();
612 }
613 else
614 {
615 UNREACHABLE();
616 return 0;
617 }
618
619 sh::GetInterfaceBlockInfo(interfaceBlock.fields, interfaceBlock.fieldPrefix(), encoder,
620 &mBlockLayout);
621
622 size_t offset = encoder->getCurrentOffset();
623
624 SafeDelete(customEncoder);
625
626 return offset;
627}
628
629bool InterfaceBlockInfo::getBlockSize(const std::string &name,
630 const std::string &mappedName,
631 size_t *sizeOut)
632{
633 size_t nameLengthWithoutArrayIndex;
634 ParseArrayIndex(name, &nameLengthWithoutArrayIndex);
635 std::string baseName = name.substr(0u, nameLengthWithoutArrayIndex);
636 auto sizeIter = mBlockSizes.find(baseName);
637 if (sizeIter == mBlockSizes.end())
638 {
639 *sizeOut = 0;
640 return false;
641 }
642
643 *sizeOut = sizeIter->second;
644 return true;
645}
646
647bool InterfaceBlockInfo::getBlockMemberInfo(const std::string &name,
648 const std::string &mappedName,
649 sh::BlockMemberInfo *infoOut)
650{
651 auto infoIter = mBlockLayout.find(name);
652 if (infoIter == mBlockLayout.end())
653 {
654 *infoOut = sh::kDefaultBlockMemberInfo;
655 return false;
656 }
657
658 *infoOut = infoIter->second;
659 return true;
660}
661} // anonymous namespace
662
663UniformLinker::UniformLinker(const ProgramState &state) : mState(state) {}
664
665UniformLinker::~UniformLinker() = default;
666
667void UniformLinker::getResults(std::vector<LinkedUniform> *uniforms,
668 std::vector<UnusedUniform> *unusedUniforms,
669 std::vector<VariableLocation> *uniformLocations)
670{
671 uniforms->swap(mUniforms);
672 unusedUniforms->swap(mUnusedUniforms);
673 uniformLocations->swap(mUniformLocations);
674}
675
676bool UniformLinker::link(const Caps &caps,
677 InfoLog &infoLog,
678 const ProgramAliasedBindings &uniformLocationBindings)
679{
680 if (mState.getAttachedShader(ShaderType::Vertex) &&
681 mState.getAttachedShader(ShaderType::Fragment))
682 {
683 ASSERT(mState.getAttachedShader(ShaderType::Compute) == nullptr);
684 if (!validateGraphicsUniforms(infoLog))
685 {
686 return false;
687 }
688 }
689
690 // Flatten the uniforms list (nested fields) into a simple list (no nesting).
691 // Also check the maximum uniform vector and sampler counts.
692 if (!flattenUniformsAndCheckCaps(caps, infoLog))
693 {
694 return false;
695 }
696
697 if (!checkMaxCombinedAtomicCounters(caps, infoLog))
698 {
699 return false;
700 }
701
702 if (!indexUniforms(infoLog, uniformLocationBindings))
703 {
704 return false;
705 }
706
707 return true;
708}
709
710bool UniformLinker::validateGraphicsUniforms(InfoLog &infoLog) const
711{
712 // Check that uniforms defined in the graphics shaders are identical
713 std::map<std::string, ShaderUniform> linkedUniforms;
714
715 for (const ShaderType shaderType : kAllGraphicsShaderTypes)
716 {
717 Shader *currentShader = mState.getAttachedShader(shaderType);
718 if (currentShader)
719 {
720 if (shaderType == ShaderType::Vertex)
721 {
722 for (const sh::ShaderVariable &vertexUniform : currentShader->getUniforms())
723 {
724 linkedUniforms[vertexUniform.name] =
725 std::make_pair(ShaderType::Vertex, &vertexUniform);
726 }
727 }
728 else
729 {
730 bool isLastShader = (shaderType == ShaderType::Fragment);
731 if (!ValidateGraphicsUniformsPerShader(currentShader, !isLastShader,
732 &linkedUniforms, infoLog))
733 {
734 return false;
735 }
736 }
737 }
738 }
739
740 return true;
741}
742
743bool UniformLinker::indexUniforms(InfoLog &infoLog,
744 const ProgramAliasedBindings &uniformLocationBindings)
745{
746 // Locations which have been allocated for an unused uniform.
747 std::set<GLuint> ignoredLocations;
748
749 int maxUniformLocation = -1;
750
751 // Gather uniform locations that have been set either using the bindUniformLocation API or by
752 // using a location layout qualifier and check conflicts between them.
753 if (!gatherUniformLocationsAndCheckConflicts(infoLog, uniformLocationBindings,
754 &ignoredLocations, &maxUniformLocation))
755 {
756 return false;
757 }
758
759 // Conflicts have been checked, now we can prune non-statically used uniforms. Code further down
760 // the line relies on only having statically used uniforms in mUniforms.
761 pruneUnusedUniforms();
762
763 // Gather uniforms that have their location pre-set and uniforms that don't yet have a location.
764 std::vector<VariableLocation> unlocatedUniforms;
765 std::map<GLuint, VariableLocation> preLocatedUniforms;
766
767 for (size_t uniformIndex = 0; uniformIndex < mUniforms.size(); uniformIndex++)
768 {
769 const LinkedUniform &uniform = mUniforms[uniformIndex];
770
771 if ((uniform.isBuiltIn() && !uniform.isEmulatedBuiltIn()) ||
772 IsAtomicCounterType(uniform.type))
773 {
774 continue;
775 }
776
777 int preSetLocation = uniformLocationBindings.getBinding(uniform);
778 int shaderLocation = uniform.location;
779
780 if (shaderLocation != -1)
781 {
782 preSetLocation = shaderLocation;
783 }
784
785 unsigned int elementCount = uniform.getBasicTypeElementCount();
786 for (unsigned int arrayIndex = 0; arrayIndex < elementCount; arrayIndex++)
787 {
788 VariableLocation location(arrayIndex, static_cast<unsigned int>(uniformIndex));
789
790 if ((arrayIndex == 0 && preSetLocation != -1) || shaderLocation != -1)
791 {
792 int elementLocation = preSetLocation + arrayIndex;
793 preLocatedUniforms[elementLocation] = location;
794 }
795 else
796 {
797 unlocatedUniforms.push_back(location);
798 }
799 }
800 }
801
802 // Make enough space for all uniforms, with pre-set locations or not.
803 mUniformLocations.resize(
804 std::max(unlocatedUniforms.size() + preLocatedUniforms.size() + ignoredLocations.size(),
805 static_cast<size_t>(maxUniformLocation + 1)));
806
807 // Assign uniforms with pre-set locations
808 for (const auto &uniform : preLocatedUniforms)
809 {
810 mUniformLocations[uniform.first] = uniform.second;
811 }
812
813 // Assign ignored uniforms
814 for (const auto &ignoredLocation : ignoredLocations)
815 {
816 mUniformLocations[ignoredLocation].markIgnored();
817 }
818
819 // Automatically assign locations for the rest of the uniforms
820 size_t nextUniformLocation = 0;
821 for (const auto &unlocatedUniform : unlocatedUniforms)
822 {
823 while (mUniformLocations[nextUniformLocation].used() ||
824 mUniformLocations[nextUniformLocation].ignored)
825 {
826 nextUniformLocation++;
827 }
828
829 ASSERT(nextUniformLocation < mUniformLocations.size());
830 mUniformLocations[nextUniformLocation] = unlocatedUniform;
831 nextUniformLocation++;
832 }
833
834 return true;
835}
836
837bool UniformLinker::gatherUniformLocationsAndCheckConflicts(
838 InfoLog &infoLog,
839 const ProgramAliasedBindings &uniformLocationBindings,
840 std::set<GLuint> *ignoredLocations,
841 int *maxUniformLocation)
842{
843 // All the locations where another uniform can't be located.
844 std::set<GLuint> reservedLocations;
845
846 for (const LinkedUniform &uniform : mUniforms)
847 {
848 if (uniform.isBuiltIn() && !uniform.isEmulatedBuiltIn())
849 {
850 continue;
851 }
852
853 int apiBoundLocation = uniformLocationBindings.getBinding(uniform);
854 int shaderLocation = uniform.location;
855
856 if (shaderLocation != -1)
857 {
858 unsigned int elementCount = uniform.getBasicTypeElementCount();
859
860 for (unsigned int arrayIndex = 0; arrayIndex < elementCount; arrayIndex++)
861 {
862 // GLSL ES 3.10 section 4.4.3
863 int elementLocation = shaderLocation + arrayIndex;
864 *maxUniformLocation = std::max(*maxUniformLocation, elementLocation);
865 if (reservedLocations.find(elementLocation) != reservedLocations.end())
866 {
867 infoLog << "Multiple uniforms bound to location " << elementLocation << ".";
868 return false;
869 }
870 reservedLocations.insert(elementLocation);
871 if (!uniform.active)
872 {
873 ignoredLocations->insert(elementLocation);
874 }
875 }
876 }
877 else if (apiBoundLocation != -1 && uniform.staticUse)
878 {
879 // Only the first location is reserved even if the uniform is an array.
880 *maxUniformLocation = std::max(*maxUniformLocation, apiBoundLocation);
881 if (reservedLocations.find(apiBoundLocation) != reservedLocations.end())
882 {
883 infoLog << "Multiple uniforms bound to location " << apiBoundLocation << ".";
884 return false;
885 }
886 reservedLocations.insert(apiBoundLocation);
887 if (!uniform.active)
888 {
889 ignoredLocations->insert(apiBoundLocation);
890 }
891 }
892 }
893
894 // Record the uniform locations that were bound using the API for uniforms that were not found
895 // from the shader. Other uniforms should not be assigned to those locations.
896 for (const auto &locationBinding : uniformLocationBindings)
897 {
898 GLuint location = locationBinding.second.location;
899 if (reservedLocations.find(location) == reservedLocations.end())
900 {
901 ignoredLocations->insert(location);
902 *maxUniformLocation = std::max(*maxUniformLocation, static_cast<int>(location));
903 }
904 }
905
906 return true;
907}
908
909void UniformLinker::pruneUnusedUniforms()
910{
911 auto uniformIter = mUniforms.begin();
912 while (uniformIter != mUniforms.end())
913 {
914 if (uniformIter->active)
915 {
916 ++uniformIter;
917 }
918 else
919 {
920 mUnusedUniforms.emplace_back(uniformIter->name, uniformIter->isSampler(),
921 uniformIter->isImage(), uniformIter->isAtomicCounter());
922 uniformIter = mUniforms.erase(uniformIter);
923 }
924 }
925}
926
927bool UniformLinker::flattenUniformsAndCheckCapsForShader(
928 Shader *shader,
929 const Caps &caps,
930 std::vector<LinkedUniform> &samplerUniforms,
931 std::vector<LinkedUniform> &imageUniforms,
932 std::vector<LinkedUniform> &atomicCounterUniforms,
933 std::vector<UnusedUniform> &unusedUniforms,
934 InfoLog &infoLog)
935{
936 ShaderUniformCount shaderUniformCount;
937 for (const sh::ShaderVariable &uniform : shader->getUniforms())
938 {
939 FlattenUniformVisitor flattener(shader->getType(), uniform, &mUniforms, &samplerUniforms,
940 &imageUniforms, &atomicCounterUniforms, &unusedUniforms);
941 sh::TraverseShaderVariable(uniform, false, &flattener);
942
943 if (uniform.active)
944 {
945 shaderUniformCount += flattener.getCounts();
946 }
947 else
948 {
949 unusedUniforms.emplace_back(uniform.name, IsSamplerType(uniform.type),
950 IsImageType(uniform.type),
951 IsAtomicCounterType(uniform.type));
952 }
953 }
954
955 ShaderType shaderType = shader->getType();
956
957 // TODO (jiawei.shao@intel.com): check whether we need finer-grained component counting
958 GLuint maxUniformVectorsCount = GetMaximumShaderUniformVectors(shaderType, caps);
959 if (shaderUniformCount.vectorCount > maxUniformVectorsCount)
960 {
961 GLuint maxUniforms = 0u;
962
963 // See comments in GetUniformResourceLimitName()
964 if (shaderType == ShaderType::Vertex || shaderType == ShaderType::Fragment)
965 {
966 maxUniforms = maxUniformVectorsCount;
967 }
968 else
969 {
970 maxUniforms = maxUniformVectorsCount * 4;
971 }
972
973 LogUniformsExceedLimit(shaderType, UniformType::Variable, maxUniforms, infoLog);
974 return false;
975 }
976
977 if (shaderUniformCount.samplerCount >
978 static_cast<GLuint>(caps.maxShaderTextureImageUnits[shaderType]))
979 {
980 LogUniformsExceedLimit(shaderType, UniformType::Sampler,
981 caps.maxShaderTextureImageUnits[shaderType], infoLog);
982 return false;
983 }
984
985 if (shaderUniformCount.imageCount >
986 static_cast<GLuint>(caps.maxShaderImageUniforms[shaderType]))
987 {
988 LogUniformsExceedLimit(shaderType, UniformType::Image,
989 caps.maxShaderImageUniforms[shaderType], infoLog);
990 return false;
991 }
992
993 if (shaderUniformCount.atomicCounterCount >
994 static_cast<GLuint>(caps.maxShaderAtomicCounters[shaderType]))
995 {
996 LogUniformsExceedLimit(shaderType, UniformType::AtomicCounter,
997 caps.maxShaderAtomicCounters[shaderType], infoLog);
998 return false;
999 }
1000
1001 return true;
1002}
1003
1004bool UniformLinker::flattenUniformsAndCheckCaps(const Caps &caps, InfoLog &infoLog)
1005{
1006 std::vector<LinkedUniform> samplerUniforms;
1007 std::vector<LinkedUniform> imageUniforms;
1008 std::vector<LinkedUniform> atomicCounterUniforms;
1009 std::vector<UnusedUniform> unusedUniforms;
1010
1011 for (const ShaderType shaderType : AllShaderTypes())
1012 {
1013 Shader *shader = mState.getAttachedShader(shaderType);
1014 if (!shader)
1015 {
1016 continue;
1017 }
1018
1019 if (!flattenUniformsAndCheckCapsForShader(shader, caps, samplerUniforms, imageUniforms,
1020 atomicCounterUniforms, unusedUniforms, infoLog))
1021 {
1022 return false;
1023 }
1024 }
1025
1026 mUniforms.insert(mUniforms.end(), samplerUniforms.begin(), samplerUniforms.end());
1027 mUniforms.insert(mUniforms.end(), imageUniforms.begin(), imageUniforms.end());
1028 mUniforms.insert(mUniforms.end(), atomicCounterUniforms.begin(), atomicCounterUniforms.end());
1029 mUnusedUniforms.insert(mUnusedUniforms.end(), unusedUniforms.begin(), unusedUniforms.end());
1030 return true;
1031}
1032
1033bool UniformLinker::checkMaxCombinedAtomicCounters(const Caps &caps, InfoLog &infoLog)
1034{
1035 unsigned int atomicCounterCount = 0;
1036 for (const auto &uniform : mUniforms)
1037 {
1038 if (IsAtomicCounterType(uniform.type) && uniform.active)
1039 {
1040 atomicCounterCount += uniform.getBasicTypeElementCount();
1041 if (atomicCounterCount > static_cast<GLuint>(caps.maxCombinedAtomicCounters))
1042 {
1043 infoLog << "atomic counter count exceeds MAX_COMBINED_ATOMIC_COUNTERS"
1044 << caps.maxCombinedAtomicCounters << ").";
1045 return false;
1046 }
1047 }
1048 }
1049 return true;
1050}
1051
1052// InterfaceBlockLinker implementation.
1053InterfaceBlockLinker::InterfaceBlockLinker(std::vector<InterfaceBlock> *blocksOut,
1054 std::vector<std::string> *unusedInterfaceBlocksOut)
1055 : mShaderBlocks({}), mBlocksOut(blocksOut), mUnusedInterfaceBlocksOut(unusedInterfaceBlocksOut)
1056{}
1057
1058InterfaceBlockLinker::~InterfaceBlockLinker() {}
1059
1060void InterfaceBlockLinker::addShaderBlocks(ShaderType shaderType,
1061 const std::vector<sh::InterfaceBlock> *blocks)
1062{
1063 mShaderBlocks[shaderType] = blocks;
1064}
1065
1066void InterfaceBlockLinker::linkBlocks(const GetBlockSizeFunc &getBlockSize,
1067 const GetBlockMemberInfoFunc &getMemberInfo) const
1068{
1069 ASSERT(mBlocksOut->empty());
1070
1071 std::set<std::string> visitedList;
1072
1073 for (const ShaderType shaderType : AllShaderTypes())
1074 {
1075 if (!mShaderBlocks[shaderType])
1076 {
1077 continue;
1078 }
1079
1080 for (const sh::InterfaceBlock &block : *mShaderBlocks[shaderType])
1081 {
1082 if (!IsActiveInterfaceBlock(block))
1083 {
1084 mUnusedInterfaceBlocksOut->push_back(block.name);
1085 continue;
1086 }
1087
1088 if (visitedList.count(block.name) == 0)
1089 {
1090 defineInterfaceBlock(getBlockSize, getMemberInfo, block, shaderType);
1091 visitedList.insert(block.name);
1092 continue;
1093 }
1094
1095 if (!block.active)
1096 {
1097 mUnusedInterfaceBlocksOut->push_back(block.name);
1098 continue;
1099 }
1100
1101 for (InterfaceBlock &priorBlock : *mBlocksOut)
1102 {
1103 if (block.name == priorBlock.name)
1104 {
1105 priorBlock.setActive(shaderType, true);
1106
1107 std::unique_ptr<sh::ShaderVariableVisitor> visitor(
1108 getVisitor(getMemberInfo, block.fieldPrefix(), block.fieldMappedPrefix(),
1109 shaderType, -1));
1110
1111 sh::TraverseShaderVariables(block.fields, false, visitor.get());
1112 }
1113 }
1114 }
1115 }
1116}
1117
1118void InterfaceBlockLinker::defineInterfaceBlock(const GetBlockSizeFunc &getBlockSize,
1119 const GetBlockMemberInfoFunc &getMemberInfo,
1120 const sh::InterfaceBlock &interfaceBlock,
1121 ShaderType shaderType) const
1122{
1123 size_t blockSize = 0;
1124 std::vector<unsigned int> blockIndexes;
1125
1126 int blockIndex = static_cast<int>(mBlocksOut->size());
1127 // Track the first and last block member index to determine the range of active block members in
1128 // the block.
1129 size_t firstBlockMemberIndex = getCurrentBlockMemberIndex();
1130
1131 std::unique_ptr<sh::ShaderVariableVisitor> visitor(
1132 getVisitor(getMemberInfo, interfaceBlock.fieldPrefix(), interfaceBlock.fieldMappedPrefix(),
1133 shaderType, blockIndex));
1134 sh::TraverseShaderVariables(interfaceBlock.fields, false, visitor.get());
1135
1136 size_t lastBlockMemberIndex = getCurrentBlockMemberIndex();
1137
1138 for (size_t blockMemberIndex = firstBlockMemberIndex; blockMemberIndex < lastBlockMemberIndex;
1139 ++blockMemberIndex)
1140 {
1141 blockIndexes.push_back(static_cast<unsigned int>(blockMemberIndex));
1142 }
1143
1144 unsigned int firstFieldArraySize = interfaceBlock.fields[0].getArraySizeProduct();
1145
1146 for (unsigned int arrayElement = 0; arrayElement < interfaceBlock.elementCount();
1147 ++arrayElement)
1148 {
1149 std::string blockArrayName = interfaceBlock.name;
1150 std::string blockMappedArrayName = interfaceBlock.mappedName;
1151 if (interfaceBlock.isArray())
1152 {
1153 blockArrayName += ArrayString(arrayElement);
1154 blockMappedArrayName += ArrayString(arrayElement);
1155 }
1156
1157 // Don't define this block at all if it's not active in the implementation.
1158 if (!getBlockSize(blockArrayName, blockMappedArrayName, &blockSize))
1159 {
1160 continue;
1161 }
1162
1163 // ESSL 3.10 section 4.4.4 page 58:
1164 // Any uniform or shader storage block declared without a binding qualifier is initially
1165 // assigned to block binding point zero.
1166 int blockBinding =
1167 (interfaceBlock.binding == -1 ? 0 : interfaceBlock.binding + arrayElement);
1168 InterfaceBlock block(interfaceBlock.name, interfaceBlock.mappedName,
1169 interfaceBlock.isArray(), arrayElement, firstFieldArraySize,
1170 blockBinding);
1171 block.memberIndexes = blockIndexes;
1172 block.setActive(shaderType, interfaceBlock.active);
1173
1174 // Since all block elements in an array share the same active interface blocks, they
1175 // will all be active once any block member is used. So, since interfaceBlock.name[0]
1176 // was active, here we will add every block element in the array.
1177 block.dataSize = static_cast<unsigned int>(blockSize);
1178 mBlocksOut->push_back(block);
1179 }
1180}
1181
1182// UniformBlockLinker implementation.
1183UniformBlockLinker::UniformBlockLinker(std::vector<InterfaceBlock> *blocksOut,
1184 std::vector<LinkedUniform> *uniformsOut,
1185 std::vector<std::string> *unusedInterfaceBlocksOut)
1186 : InterfaceBlockLinker(blocksOut, unusedInterfaceBlocksOut), mUniformsOut(uniformsOut)
1187{}
1188
1189UniformBlockLinker::~UniformBlockLinker() {}
1190
1191size_t UniformBlockLinker::getCurrentBlockMemberIndex() const
1192{
1193 return mUniformsOut->size();
1194}
1195
1196sh::ShaderVariableVisitor *UniformBlockLinker::getVisitor(
1197 const GetBlockMemberInfoFunc &getMemberInfo,
1198 const std::string &namePrefix,
1199 const std::string &mappedNamePrefix,
1200 ShaderType shaderType,
1201 int blockIndex) const
1202{
1203 return new UniformBlockEncodingVisitor(getMemberInfo, namePrefix, mappedNamePrefix,
1204 mUniformsOut, shaderType, blockIndex);
1205}
1206
1207// ShaderStorageBlockLinker implementation.
1208ShaderStorageBlockLinker::ShaderStorageBlockLinker(
1209 std::vector<InterfaceBlock> *blocksOut,
1210 std::vector<BufferVariable> *bufferVariablesOut,
1211 std::vector<std::string> *unusedInterfaceBlocksOut)
1212 : InterfaceBlockLinker(blocksOut, unusedInterfaceBlocksOut),
1213 mBufferVariablesOut(bufferVariablesOut)
1214{}

1216ShaderStorageBlockLinker::~ShaderStorageBlockLinker() {}
1217
1218size_t ShaderStorageBlockLinker::getCurrentBlockMemberIndex() const
1219{
1220 return mBufferVariablesOut->size();
1221}
1222
1223sh::ShaderVariableVisitor *ShaderStorageBlockLinker::getVisitor(
1224 const GetBlockMemberInfoFunc &getMemberInfo,
1225 const std::string &namePrefix,
1226 const std::string &mappedNamePrefix,
1227 ShaderType shaderType,
1228 int blockIndex) const
1229{

1231 mBufferVariablesOut, shaderType, blockIndex);
1232}
1233
1234// AtomicCounterBufferLinker implementation.
1235AtomicCounterBufferLinker::AtomicCounterBufferLinker(
1236 std::vector<AtomicCounterBuffer> *atomicCounterBuffersOut)
1237 : mAtomicCounterBuffersOut(atomicCounterBuffersOut)
1238{}
1239
1240AtomicCounterBufferLinker::~AtomicCounterBufferLinker() {}
1241
1242void AtomicCounterBufferLinker::link(const std::map<int, unsigned int> &sizeMap) const
1243{
1244 for (auto &atomicCounterBuffer : *mAtomicCounterBuffersOut)
1245 {
1246 auto bufferSize = sizeMap.find(atomicCounterBuffer.binding);
1247 ASSERT(bufferSize != sizeMap.end());
1248 atomicCounterBuffer.dataSize = bufferSize->second;
1249 }
1250}
1251
1252ProgramLinkedResources::ProgramLinkedResources(
1253 GLuint maxVaryingVectors,
1254 PackMode packMode,
1255 std::vector<InterfaceBlock> *uniformBlocksOut,
1256 std::vector<LinkedUniform> *uniformsOut,
1257 std::vector<InterfaceBlock> *shaderStorageBlocksOut,
1258 std::vector<BufferVariable> *bufferVariablesOut,
1259 std::vector<AtomicCounterBuffer> *atomicCounterBuffersOut)
1260 : varyingPacking(maxVaryingVectors, packMode),
1261 uniformBlockLinker(uniformBlocksOut, uniformsOut, &unusedInterfaceBlocks),
1262 shaderStorageBlockLinker(shaderStorageBlocksOut, bufferVariablesOut, &unusedInterfaceBlocks),
1263 atomicCounterBufferLinker(atomicCounterBuffersOut)
1264{}
1265
1266ProgramLinkedResources::~ProgramLinkedResources() = default;
1267
1268void ProgramLinkedResourcesLinker::linkResources(const ProgramState &programState,
1269 const ProgramLinkedResources &resources) const
1270{
1271 // Gather uniform interface block info.
1272 InterfaceBlockInfo uniformBlockInfo(mCustomEncoderFactory);
1273 for (const ShaderType shaderType : AllShaderTypes())
1274 {
1275 Shader *shader = programState.getAttachedShader(shaderType);
1276 if (shader)
1277 {
1278 uniformBlockInfo.getShaderBlockInfo(shader->getUniformBlocks());
1279 }
1280 }
1281
1282 auto getUniformBlockSize = [&uniformBlockInfo](const std::string &name,
1283 const std::string &mappedName, size_t *sizeOut) {
1284 return uniformBlockInfo.getBlockSize(name, mappedName, sizeOut);
1285 };
1286
1287 auto getUniformBlockMemberInfo = [&uniformBlockInfo](const std::string &name,
1288 const std::string &mappedName,
1289 sh::BlockMemberInfo *infoOut) {
1290 return uniformBlockInfo.getBlockMemberInfo(name, mappedName, infoOut);
1291 };
1292
1293 // Link uniform interface blocks.
1294 resources.uniformBlockLinker.linkBlocks(getUniformBlockSize, getUniformBlockMemberInfo);
1295
1296 // Gather storage bufer interface block info.
1297 InterfaceBlockInfo shaderStorageBlockInfo(mCustomEncoderFactory);
1298 for (const ShaderType shaderType : AllShaderTypes())
1299 {
1300 Shader *shader = programState.getAttachedShader(shaderType);
1301 if (shader)
1302 {
1303 shaderStorageBlockInfo.getShaderBlockInfo(shader->getShaderStorageBlocks());
1304 }
1305 }
1306 auto getShaderStorageBlockSize = [&shaderStorageBlockInfo](const std::string &name,
1307 const std::string &mappedName,
1308 size_t *sizeOut) {
1309 return shaderStorageBlockInfo.getBlockSize(name, mappedName, sizeOut);
1310 };
1311
1312 auto getShaderStorageBlockMemberInfo = [&shaderStorageBlockInfo](const std::string &name,
1313 const std::string &mappedName,
1314 sh::BlockMemberInfo *infoOut) {
1315 return shaderStorageBlockInfo.getBlockMemberInfo(name, mappedName, infoOut);
1316 };
1317
1318 // Link storage buffer interface blocks.
1319 resources.shaderStorageBlockLinker.linkBlocks(getShaderStorageBlockSize,
1320 getShaderStorageBlockMemberInfo);
1321
1322 // Gather and link atomic counter buffer interface blocks.
1323 std::map<int, unsigned int> sizeMap;
1324 getAtomicCounterBufferSizeMap(programState, sizeMap);
1325 resources.atomicCounterBufferLinker.link(sizeMap);
1326}
1327
1328void ProgramLinkedResourcesLinker::getAtomicCounterBufferSizeMap(
1329 const ProgramState &programState,
1330 std::map<int, unsigned int> &sizeMapOut) const
1331{
1332 for (unsigned int index : programState.getAtomicCounterUniformRange())
1333 {
1334 const LinkedUniform &glUniform = programState.getUniforms()[index];
1335
1336 auto &bufferDataSize = sizeMapOut[glUniform.binding];
1337
1338 // Calculate the size of the buffer by finding the end of the last uniform with the same
1339 // binding. The end of the uniform is calculated by finding the initial offset of the
1340 // uniform and adding size of the uniform. For arrays, the size is the number of elements
1341 // times the element size (should always by 4 for atomic_units).
1342 unsigned dataOffset =
1343 glUniform.offset + static_cast<unsigned int>(glUniform.getBasicTypeElementCount() *
1344 glUniform.getElementSize());
1345 if (dataOffset > bufferDataSize)
1346 {
1347 bufferDataSize = dataOffset;
1348 }
1349 }
1350}

1352} // namespace gl
